channel.title: Reinstalling Steam
channel.description: Bloody typical now that BM has a release date, my main hdd has gone wonky. (clunk of death and lockups) Anyway, just set up another drive to boot from with a clean OS install and now to install Steam. My question is, after installing Steam, is it possible to drag the games etc from the olde drive to the new one, without having to download all the games again, which would take forever? Anyone tried this? Cheers :slight_smile:

item.title: Reinstalling Steam
item.dc:creator: The_Scientist
item.description:
Works a treat, thanks.
Learn something every day…

Read full topic

item.title: Reinstalling Steam

item.description:
Hey, this is nice to know, if only I knew this when I switched to a new pc 2 months ago… oh well

Read full topic

item.title: Reinstalling Steam
item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
Yeah Steam is incredibly portable. You can literally delete everything except the main steam.exe and steamapps folder, move JUST the steam.exe and steamapps folder, and it will just automatically fix itself when you run it from the new location.

Then you can clean up the old location, and tada! Steam location moved. Zero hassle.

Read full topic

item.title: Reinstalling Steam
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
the registry entries it makes are for mods and other installers to find out where Steam is located IIRC

Read full topic

item.title: Reinstalling Steam
item.dc:creator: Zageron
item.description:
A scientist:

Hey that’s great, thanks!
Sounds like Steam is portable lol.
Are there no registry entries?

There are, but they’re unnecessary. Either that or they set themselves if they don’t exist.

item.title: Reinstalling Steam

item.description:
Yeah. I keep my whole steam folder on a separate drive to my OS, to avoid the small hassle.

item.title: Reinstalling Steam
item.dc:creator: johnyo
item.description:
You don’t even need to reinstall steam, provided you’ve left the whole steam folder intact.
Just run the executable, steam is cool like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Reinstalling Steam
item.dc:creator: Zageron
item.description:
Yeah, this is very simple to do.
Just copy the steamapps folder from your old installation into the new one.

Read full topic

item.title: Reinstalling Steam

item.description:
Bloody typical now that BM has a release date, my main hdd has gone wonky. (clunk of death and lockups)
Anyway, just set up another drive to boot from with a clean OS install and now to install Steam.
My question is, after installing Steam, is it possible to drag the games etc from the olde drive to the new one, without having to download all the games again, which would take forever?
Anyone tried this?
Cheers
